body:
Comment 11: 
Sorry to dig up this issue, but how about printing the type for non-simple types, but
keep the current behavior for built-in types? So 
    foo := 1
    fmt.Printf("%#v", foo) 
would just print 1
but
    type Mytype int
    foo := Mytype(1)
    fmt.Printf("%#v", foo)

would print main.Mytype(1)
